titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Riva Rosenfield Papers on Camp Wo-Chi-Ca and Camp Higley Hill TAM.434
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-07-17T10:50-0400

change.item: Edited by Bonnie Gordon to reflect updated administrative information and changed title

did.unittitle: Riva Rosenfield Papers on Camp Wo-Chi-Ca and Camp Higley Hill

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at the Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
relatedmaterial.p: Grace Granich and Manny Granich Papers (TAM 255)

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Riva Rosenfield attended and was involved with the Communist-associated Workers Children's Camp (Camp Wo-Chi-Ca).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This small collection includes writings on Camp Wo-Chi-Ca. Some documents also touch on Higley Hill, another camp run and staffed by the Communist Party of America. A set of photographs of Higley Hill and its campers from the early 1950's remains in the collection. The collection also contains a file of FBI and WPA papers on Herbert Gurewitz obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Riva Rosenfield, the creator of this collection, were transferred to New York University in 2008. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Riva Rosenfield, 2008. The accession number associated with this gift is 2008.019.
